title: YouTube tests turning off notifications for channels you don’t watch
snippets: YouTube is conducting a test where it will disable push notifications for channels that upload frequently and for which users have set notifications to "all" but often ignore these alerts. This change aims to reduce notification clutter but may result in users missing updates from these channels.
summary: YouTube is testing a new feature that turns off push notifications for channels that post often and are frequently ignored by users who have opted for "all" notifications. This is intended to decrease the amount of unnecessary alerts, though it could lead to users missing updates from these channels.

title: Google to pay $100 million to settle 14-year-old advertising lawsuit
snippets: Google agreed to pay $100 million to settle a lawsuit alleging it charged advertisers for clicks on ads outside their selected geographic areas. The settlement, awaiting judicial approval, was filed in a California court.
summary: Google has agreed to a $100 million settlement in a lawsuit claiming it billed advertisers for clicks on ads that appeared outside their chosen geographic areas. This agreement is pending approval from a California court.

title: Helldivers 2 is locking out players who use older CPUs

summary: Helldivers 2 players with older computers are facing issues running the game because it requires AVX2 support, a CPU feature standard since 2013. This requirement comes from the game's developer, Arrowhead Game Studios, and its publisher, Sony.
